Reviews.Title: “Wonderful 717 !”
Reviews.Author: Izhak F
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel, suite, service and location! Indeed, one of the best properties in Amsterdam, not to be missed!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service in this Canal House Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: advice55
Reviews.Content: An excellent experience. We were greeted warmly with a glass on wine when we arrived at 11pm and instantly felt at home in the comfortable lounge and library. We enjoyed looking at all the quirky art and artefacts on display. So much more interesting than a chain hotel. We stayed 2 nights in the Tolkien suite which was large and comfortably furnished with a king sized bed, large sofa and plenty of seating areas. No canal view but it had high ceilings and lots of light. The bed was very comfortable and bed linen top quality. Bathroom was not very modern but was big enough with a separate bath and shower and was spotlessly clean. Throughout our stay the service was exemplary with staff on hand to bring glasses of wine, tea, cakes and biscuits whenever we requested and all complimentary. Can't fault it really. We'll definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “you can get cheaper but not better! Holland heaven.”
Reviews.Author: olgiati
Reviews.Content: fantastic customer service. nothing too much trouble. beautifully restored canal house, relaxing surroundings, lvely rooms and a really nice breakfast. tea and biscuits when we arrived at 11am, bottle of wine at 5pm and snacks , hot chocolate in china cups before bed. Holland Heaven.

Reviews.Title: “marvelous”
Reviews.Author: claire m
Reviews.Content: from first minute every thing was perfect , great staff , very helpful , not snooty . Lovely room , top shower and most comfortable bed . Lovely breakfast with lots fresh fruit , pastrys , cheese and great coffee . Afternoon tea outside [ chocolates and biscuits ] . Then wine in our suite with more snacks . Plus a near perfect location , the canals , the boutiques , the museums , all are just there . Romantic and perfect .

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, discreet and eclectically furnished hotel”
Reviews.Author: anita b
Reviews.Content: On arrival our bags were taken to the room while we sat in one of the beautifully decorated reception rooms and checked in over welcoming coffee and cakes. Staying in the Mahler suite which is on the second floor facing into the garden patio away from the canal side we enjoyed a delightful quiet and relaxing weekend. Service was great, plenty of anytime drinks and snacks provided with a selection of good wines also on offer. The surrounding area is bustling in itself and located well for most other places of interest to be within walking distance. Breakfast started with fresh fruit, orange juice and of course good coffee or tea. Following on with eggs done to your own request (though i did ask for a poached egg and got a fried one) plus ham, bacon etc all served with a basket of various breads, toast and croissants. Our stay was perfect we would happily return to this lovely, discreet and eclectically furnished hotel.

Reviews.Title: “For its price, last resort!”
Reviews.Author: Eshaan S
Reviews.Content: Everything was mediocre, not good not bad. But for the price I paid I was expecting much much better. I'd say there are many more hotels in the city , cheaper and better.

Reviews.Title: “Dreadful, don't go there....read on....”
Reviews.Author: snowqueen75
Reviews.Content: We booked using Expedia only to be told on arrival that the booking had failed (despite our confirmation). Expedia doesn't usually get it wrong!! The hotel was cold, damp and unwelcoming. Four flights of death defying near vertical stairs led us to a weird room. The welcome bottle of champagne in the room had been emptied and the foil put back, presumably to help poorer guests imagine what champagne might look like. In the morning of our enforced departure, they offered to get us a taxi. We tried to have breakfast while waiting and wondered if we would have time for a boiled egg after a sad and tired apology for a fruit salad ( it looked like it had had a worse nights sleep than we had!). We needn't have worried, we'd have had time for a slow cooked hog roast. The taxi still hasn't arrived as yet. They offered us a free nights stay as compensation. I don't think so! At 400 euros a night, avoid at all costs...

Reviews.Title: “sophisticated boutique hotel - warm and welcoming”
Reviews.Author: saltireblue
Reviews.Content: We arrived on a bitterly cold but Sunny February Day for my wife's birthday trip to Amsterdam, having carefully selected this hotel from a number of review sites. We are careful not to rely on one site due to the inconsistency of reviewers and their foibles. Rest assured, this hotel will not dissapoint once you have decided on the price and booking. Everything else is taken care of when you arrive from the charming welcome drinks and biscuits to the wonderful anytime service of teas coffees biscuits and wine and soft drinks all included in the tariff. Breakfast was beautifully done, a full continental with all the trimmings you need without the pressure of larger hotel offerings. The location is perfect and we were able to walk to all visitor areas, restaurants, museums and shopping. The only taxi/car usage was to the airport and do allow the hotel to arrange a car as we found this no more expensive than the taxi we took from the airport. Friends met us for pre dinner drinks and the option of three very comfortable public rooms to welcome them in to a roaring fire on a cold day was wonderful, reminding us of the very pleasant boutique hotel we use in London in the same way. Our junior suite Tolkien (4) was very spacious and aside from the unusual bathroom door arrangement was excellent for our purposes and on the quieter side of the Hotel. That said I would not expect there to be an issue on the canal side certainly not in the low season. We will certainly be back again perhaps in warmer weather. We recommend the Hermitage Museum, and do try the Lucius Fish Restaurant. The Hotel also has some excellent recommendations which we took up. This Hotel makes a visit to Amsterdam even more enjoyable. Turn up and relax.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel and worth every cent.”
Reviews.Author: MonroGroup
Reviews.Content: Situated close to hand to everything that makes Amsterdam special including the glorious Prinsengracht canal with its fine houses and architecture, traditional bakery on the corner and cheese shops only a minute away. What made this hotel extra special was the quiet, dignified service from the warm friendly welcome to the Mercedes transfer at the end of our stay. Combined with expert local knowledge, restaurant recommendations and a huge effort made on the hotel's part to book us a table during this New Year period, illustrates perfectly their dedication to service. Staying in the Picasso Suite it took the first floor of this magnificent former merchants house and was equipped with fine artworks, 6 or so huge windows opening onto the canal and a bed with some of the finest Egyptian cotton I've ever encountered! With complimentary wine of great quality delivered to your room, complimentary bar and afternoon tea should you wish to take it, this hotel will not only enhance your trip to this beautiful city but will enhance it.

Reviews.Title: “A true jewel”
Reviews.Author: MarkS S
Reviews.Content: Our recent one night stay at Hotel Seven One Seven could not have been more perfect. All the rooms and suites are unique and the staff was kind enough to let us change to an even more special room than the one we had reserved online. The charm and subtle elegance of Amsterdam is echoed in every part of this hotel and the service is impeccable.

Reviews.Title: “remarkable gem right on the canals”
Reviews.Author: Baida888
Reviews.Content: I'm so impressed and surprised of not knowing this lovely boutique hotel offered charm yet modern ammenities, history without compromising the standards. The hotel staff were very accomadating and the concierge has helped me drop off a few Christmass gifts that I was unable to delivery myself since my trip was cut short. The breakfast was fresh and perfect with its small windows overlooking the tiny patio. Flowers were arranged meticulously and the china, cloths & napkins were so perfectly thought of. There are 3 lounge areas with fireplaces, magazines and a great place to host guests. I have recommended this property for my friends especially for those who want intimacy, quality and that special something.

Reviews.Title: “First class experience”
Reviews.Author: Carsten H
Reviews.Content: I am a regular Amsterdam visitor and recently stayed at the Seven one Seven for the first time following a friend's recommendation and had a truely exceptional experience. It is a wonderful and centrally located boutique hotel, a home away from home. There is tons of detail, the staff is very passionate and was really helpful securing a booking for a great dinner venue. Will definitely go again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel in perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Nicle1
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the beautiful Mahler Suite and felt very comfortable. The staff is very friendly, helpful and hospitably. The breakfast was delicious. Especially the lovely decoration of the hotel with a lot of wonderful details impressed us. We can really recommend this hotel for a unique stay in Amsterdam. Furthermore the location is perfect: all important sights etc. are in walking distance. Thank you again for this great stay!!

Reviews.Title: “Overall a good stay...”
Reviews.Author: GlobalJC
Reviews.Content: Stayed here one night during a congress this fall. The location is lovely, and the hotel itself, while somewhat quirky, has a laid back, welcoming vibe to it as well. I was greeted very warmly and every effort was made to make me feel at home. I enjoyed a good nights sleep, a good breakfast - the only hitch was that the reception had forgotten to book my taxi for the morning after, as a business traveller that is somewhat annoying but she admitted her mistake & ordered a new taxi that came very quickly, so no harm done.

Reviews.Title: “in my third stay,it's only getting better”
Reviews.Author: shilod
Reviews.Content: the only problem with the 717 in Amsterdam is that it guarantee disappointment in any other hotel... Rooms are stunning, walking outside seems like a wrong move. hotel staff is friendly and smart, helpful and glowing with charm. there's no doubt that we'll be back for more.

Reviews.Title: “one of the best hotels in best location you can imagine”
Reviews.Author: Abel A
Reviews.Content: You have all transportation in the corner you have de best restaurants near by. And the best room you can cooose

Reviews.Title: “Well within my top 5 hotels”
Reviews.Author: Geoff C
Reviews.Content: Possibly unbeatable location, definitely unbeatable service, a stunning room (Shakespeare - view not the greatest and the bed could be better positioned, but these really are minor gripes, especially as there are other rooms with canal views and different layouts). We had an amazing long weekend here and am reluctant to review the hotel as would love to keep it a secret. Amsterdam is probably the nicest city that I've visited so that obviously enhanced the whole experience anyway. So, yes, through gritted teeth and under my breath I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The best place to stay in Amsterdam!”
Reviews.Author: Susan R
Reviews.Content: We stayed in The Room at the Top and it was like having our own pied-d-terre in Amsterdam. The staff was friendly and very helpful. The breakfasts kept us full until dinner time. There's not one thing I would change about our stay there. It was perfect and we hope someday to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Best stay in Amsterdam ever”
Reviews.Author: Marcvt
Reviews.Content: For a buisiness stay in Amsterdam we stayed in Hotel Seven one Seven and had a perfect meeting, days and night. We enjoyed the hospitality and great ambiance.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely WONDERFUL!”
Reviews.Author: Linda1613
Reviews.Content: First class all the way! Could not have asked for anything better. Beautiful spacious rooms, delightful and attentive staff, great location. Everything was absolutely perfect, beyond expectations!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice and authentic hotel”
Reviews.Author: zg2009
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Seven one Seven on our trip to Amsterdam this August. It is a wonderful and very authentic place. If you ever wondered what it feels like to live in a canal-side house this hotel is for you. The common rooms on the first floor especially reinforce that feeling. The room that we have stayed at (Shakespeare suite) was large, comfortable and nicely decorated. The service is provided by very friendly and accommodating staff and it was seamless. I would absolutely stay at 717 again.

Reviews.Title: “the perfect home away from home”
Reviews.Author: janDeBont
Reviews.Content: I discovered this hotel years ago and kept coming back either with my family or by myself. Having lived in Amsterdam, I know that no other Hotel represents Amsterdam more than Hotel 717. Each time I ring their doorbell, it is if I am entering my home away from home. Beautifully decorated in a superb real vintage Amsterdam style, you enter a place that you can only imagine Amsterdam to be in the "golden age". From the first moment you enter, the staff of the hotel wants to make you feel at home while entering their great period living room. The service is all you can possibly expect. It is welcoming, subtle, and incredibly warm. Each room is different in decoration with great works of art and It is hard to believe that you can find such a quiet, romantic and comfortable place right in the center of such a busy city,. Surrounded by the great museums, of Amsterdam, famous antique stores and delicious and stylish restaurants like "George" and "Envy" and many more, it is a perfect place to spend for any special romantic occasion but also the best place to be if you have to be in Amsterdam for business. My favorite is their breakfast in a room that you would love to be your own breakfast room.

Reviews.Title: “Five Star Excellence”
Reviews.Author: Kim R
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at Hotel Seven One Seven - can't say enough about it. Beautifully decorated, spacious rooms, amazing full breakfast and ideal location. Only eight guest rooms so very quiet and private. Staff goes out of their way to attend to your needs. Would recommend taking a private canal boat ride.

Reviews.Title: “What an amazing Pride weekend!”
Reviews.Author: Christianhodell
Reviews.Content: Sensational place. Beautiful, tasteful, terrific food, lovely tea and GREAT staff. Fab location as well.

Reviews.Title: “Unforgetable experience!!!”
Reviews.Author: Dgleizer
Reviews.Content: Our time at 717 was unforgetable. Everything worked to perfection: both rooms were great - cosy, beautiful, clean and well lit. The common areas of the hotel were also very attractive and confortable. Breakfast was fantastic. The kids used it as a measuring rod in the other hotels were are visiting during this trip. And I can assure you this is not a biased view resulting from Julio's brazilian nationality. He was most efficient and nice. But so were the other guys at the hotel. ServiceOur time at 717 was unforgetable. Everything worked to perfection: both rooms were great - cosy, beautiful, clean and well lit. The common areas of the hotel were also very attractive and confortable. Breakfast was fantastic. The kids are using it as a measuring rod in the other hotels we visited during this trip. And I can assure you this is not a biased view resulting from Julio's brazilian nationality. He was most efficient and nice. But so were the other guys at the hotel. Service was impecable. Sabine's (the assistant manager) assistance in helping us set up the trip, guide recommendations and overall sugestions were great. Finally, I cannot finish without mentioning her constant attention and care thoughout our visit. Having her managing our stay really made a difference. I have no doubt that whenever I return to Amsterdam I will stay at 717 again. I recommend it as I can. Daniel Gleizer and Family

Reviews.Title: “One of my favorite hotels of all time”
Reviews.Author: loudab
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent four nights at the Seven one Seven. We had been traveling for the week prior to our stay there and arrived there at 6:30pm unsure of what to expect. We were greeted by Jerko, one of the several wonderfully welcoming staff we encountered there. Jerko checked us in and then asked if we'd like a bottle of wine and "snacks." We climbed the stairs up to the 3rd floor--we were staying in the Picasso Suite which overlooks a canal. The room was gorgeous and comfortable--a hotel room with charm, personality and every creature comfort you could ask for. We loved it. One of my least favorite things about high end hotels is that they so often nickel and dime you for every little thing. Want a bottle of water? That's five bucks? Want a bottle of wine? That's forty bucks. At the Seven one Seven, however, all food and drink is included in your room rate. Wine, cheese, olives, beer, bottled water, Diet Coke--it's all included. We loved that aspect of the Seven one Seven. Each day we would wake, go downstairs for a very good breakfast (including warm chocolate croissants!), head out, explore the city for most of the day, come home, have a bottle of wine and snacks sent up, spend a couple of hours relaxing (the internet is free as well) and then head back out. When we came home at night, we'd be greeted by a charming staff person all of whom unfailingly asked us if there was anything we needed. Our room on the canal was louder at night than I'd have liked although the Seven one Seven is in a relatively sedate part of town. The hotel does the best they can with heavy windows and interior and exterior shutters, but, if you are a light sleeper, I'd ask for an interior room. On the other hand, we loved the view from our suite. We stayed at two other high end hotels on our trip and, of the three establishments, this was by far our favorite.

Reviews.Title: “Exquisite decor, tranquil setting and delightful location make for a charming hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Gallivant1
Reviews.Content: My young daughter and I had a lovely, restful evening at 717. This is a delightful hotel, situated in a sumptuous, historic canal house on Prinsengracht - a grand canal lined with splendid houses and funky bars and cafes. We were 2 tram stops - or an easy walk - from the Rijksmuseum (Amsterdam's most impressive art gallery). 717 is a peaceful place; glorious decor and serene classical music combine to ensure a tranquil ambience throughout. There is a small outdoor patio and a bright, airy breakfast room, serving delicious warm pastries every morning. Our suite (Van Goethe) was elegant - if a little traditional, even old-fashioned - but spacious. Air conditioning didn't operate when the temperature outside was deemed too cool, but at least a fan was provided. The bathroom was serviceable though a tad pokey, especially access to the shower cubicle. The hotel offers free wifi (password protected) but the system must have froze during our stay as I was unable to log on late at night. I was duly informed that the 24 hr staff could have reset the internet for me, whatever time of day and night! The staff were pleasant and helpful at all times. The evening we stayed, my daughter and I were caught in a rain-storm, then furnished with free refreshments and warm blankets, which was very welcome!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay”
Reviews.Author: Marike_D
Reviews.Content: We were back in Amsterdam to meet up with friends and had a lovely stay at Seven One Seven. Great service and a friendly atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Great Beginning to a great trip”
Reviews.Author: Thebigragoo
Reviews.Content: After spending 3 hours on the tarmac before a 6 hour flight and nearly missing the train from Paris to Amsterdam, Hotel 717 was an shining ray of glory to a pair of weary travelers. Upon check-in we requested a bottle of wine to settle in and relax before hitting the city. After the wine was brought (with olives, cheese, and mustard!) and after a shower underneath the rain style shower head, we had a lot of trouble pulling ourselves away from the room. This was just in the first two hours! The bed was comfortable and the room was exquisite and smartly decorated. The service was key in our enjoyment of the city by giving directions and suggesting nightlife and dining options, this was not what was deserving of the 5 rating however. I really felt like I was staying with a family friend at the Hotel 717 and the staff pursued that feeling by being attentive and caring in every interaction. I would most certainly recommend Hotel 717 to anyone touring Amsterdam looking for a higher level of class.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding and familiar”
Reviews.Author: musician1959
Reviews.Content: Outstanding, clean hotels with wonderful, large rooms, very individual, old and charming furniture and details. Plus: drinks from the Minibar and wine included in the (erxpensive) room's rate. Minus: bad internet connection. Nice and competent service, breakfast could be improved. The room service menu is definitely too small. Good beds (altough not really outstanding), rooms in the back are great, those in the front can be quite noisy. Unfortunately they don't accept pets.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: MariaLeglize
Reviews.Content: We went with some friends who recommended the hotel as have been there before. We got there and it looks like a house not an standard hotel at all. The whole atmosfere is very homy and Ralph Laurenish style. The rooms are incredible, each of them different. The staff extremely helpful, charming and willing to make the best of our stay. We will be back for sure!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “We will definitely return to this very special hotel (or rather â€œhomeâ€�)!!”
Reviews.Author: lghammer
Reviews.Content: We had such a wonderful time during our stay at 717. The atmosphere, the service, the house, the room, your nice help (always). It was in every aspect a very positive experience. We will definitely return to this very special hotel (or rather â€œhomeâ€�)!!

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: twocitygal
Reviews.Content: My husband and I originally chose this hotel based on a recommendation from our CountryclubUK membership and it's location. I am so glad we stayed there as it truly helped make our visit to Amsterdam wonderful. The hotel felt like we were staying in a very wealthy friend's home. It was extremely inviting, comfortable yet elegant and charming. No detail was missed from the candles burning all throughout the day, the fresh gorgeous flowers throughout the hotel, the delicious breakfasts and lovely art work throughout the hotel. The staff went out of their way to make us feel welcomed and well looked after. They offered us coffee/tea/wine when we got back to our room in the afternoon and it was all part of the price! Even the minibar contents were included in the price. Sadly, we stayed at the Pulitzer hotel on our 3rd night in town and what a mistake that was. It was such a letdown after staying at Seven One Seven that we wished we could go back! I would recommend this hotel in a second and will certainly go back when we visit Amsterdam again.

Reviews.Title: “A warm welcome”
Reviews.Author: elena55555
Reviews.Content: All I wished for. Great vibe and lovely service. I felt at home, and that was lovely since I had a busy week. Thanks a lot again!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect boutique hotel, the best 5 star”
Reviews.Author: Michael_mor
Reviews.Content: This hotel is absolutely my number one in Amsterdam. We had a beautiful suite Tolkien with beautiful view. The hotel is full of great staff, they still offer to the guests biscuits, tea, cakes, drinks.. That was so fine. The location is fantastic, close to museums, canal and many other attraction. DonÂ´t forget to rent a bike on MikeyÂ´s!

Reviews.Title: “awesome luxury hotel.”
Reviews.Author: theodori83
Reviews.Content: The hotel was one of the best in Holland. We stayed Schubert room for 2days and the room at the top for 3days. Great and Exclusive service and everything in the hotel was just perfect.(I loved the complimentary breakfast) I miss Hotel 717. The staffs were also super nice. You should definitely stay Hotel 717 when you go to AMS.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't recommend this hotel highly enough”
Reviews.Author: caldychase
Reviews.Content: Perfect location, stunning rooms and friendly staff. Bliss! Can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Nice private atmosphere with very friendly service”
Reviews.Author: Matt-Runner
Reviews.Content: Bright and large suite like room. Nice furniture with a lof of interesting heavy cloths, curtains. Tea, coffee, biscuits, wine was served at any time (and free of chare) in one of the three living rooms with always burning fire-places ot in the room. Recommendations fÃ¼r dinner have been very good and very much in line with our expectations. So it was a pleasant stay for a marathon weekend in a real personal, small, nice AND professoinal hotel.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best and most unique hotels that i have stayed in....and i have stayed in a lot!”
Reviews.Author: LucyEEEEEEEE
Reviews.Content: The 717 is a beautiful town house sitting on one of Amsterdams unique canals near the 9 streets shopping area and just down the road from the Anne Frank museum. The house is immaculate with beautiful rooms and incredible friendly service. I was there with my 11 year old daughter for a one on one treat, and they really could not have been more amenable....ready with advise, booking restaurants and general information. You ask for a cup of tea and it comes with delicious chocolates, biscuits and mini cup cakes, when a glass of wine it comes with nuts and olives.....and all, the drinks and the snacks, are complimentary. Such a nice touch that adds to this feeling like a very luxurious home from home. I can not recommend it highly enough and hope to come back with my husband soon.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, as if you have a home on the canal in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: CarolineBaarn
Reviews.Content: Hotel 717 is a great hotel with fantastic service and super cool interior decoration. Very helpful and serviceminded staff, we had a lovely breakfast in our room and every time we came into the hotel the staff was there, offering us drinks and/or snacks. The location could not be better, shops and museums within walking distance. Our room was spacious, very comfortable and made us feel at home, not in a hotel. Go and find out for yourself, you will not be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “perfect”
Reviews.Author: fastfal
Reviews.Content: great location, very good service and the house itself is elegant without excess. next time in amsterdam will see me back there...

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel; Service Plus...but fix the a/c”
Reviews.Author: Kildonan_kid
Reviews.Content: Very lovely hotel, very close to the museum area and just off one of the main walking streets/tram/etc. Excellent service - cannot say enough for the personal service at this small boutique hotel. Very much a home feeling. We stayed in the Shakespeare Room...lovely - great bed, lots of room for 2 - have bf in bed or downstairs in the dining room - freshfruit, breads, and even enough leftovers for a small sandwich snack later in the day during your travels. A mix of guest, from businesspeople, tourists, etc. A couple of great rooms for meetings, get together, etc in the front - if you were there on business, get-togethers, etc. On one of the evenings, they had some trouble with guests (with adjoining rooms) that were moving back and forth (a little heavy-footed) early in the morning. Because of the style of the hotel/house, it did interrupt our sleep a bit, but both the manager and their staff apologized profusely for the unexpected noise at the morning breakfast. Before going, I had read another review, which mentioned the a/c not working. Fortunately the 4-days we were in Amsterdam, were not too hot, and we didn't really need it. They supplied a fan, which was more than adequate for the temperature, and put in window screens so that we could open the windows, if we wanted. The lack of A/C did not affect our enjoyment of our stay, but if the weather had been warmer, this review could have been much different. Hopefully, they fix it sooner rather than later. All in all, we were very satisfied with the hotel, with the location, great personal service, and home feeling, we would definitely stay again. I would check to make sure the a/c is fixed if going in the summer..... We rented bikes (Mike's - just around the block) for a couple days - should have rented from the start - but we loved the walking/biking/cafe lifestyle of the Dutch... great place to visit.

Reviews.Title: “Extraordinary experience staying at this hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: Miami_traveler35
Reviews.Content: The management and staff of this hotel have it down exactly right. From a delicious breakfast in the morning to wine and cheese and other delights in the afternoon, everyone at the hotel puts extraordinary care in making sure that the guests are extremely well attended. Internet service was included at no additional cost. Amsterdam is a beautiful city and when one combines the visit with at stay at the Hotel Seven One Seven......how can I not return.

Reviews.Title: “unique and full of character”
Reviews.Author: mememememe317068
Reviews.Content: I spent 3 nights camping just outside Amsterdam and was looking forward to 2 nights of luxury, this place did not disappoint. The hotel is beautifully furnished in a unique way, feels very homely and posh at the same time. The room was very comfortable, lovely furnishings and antiques. The TV was great, although we didn't watch a lot of it. We had complimentary wine, beer and nibbles, the nibbles even included steak tartar, which was a first! The service was great and the staff helpful. We stayed in the room at the top and we loved it. It was not without a couple of problems. Firstly it was not quite as clean as i would have hoped, the bedding was spotless but the walls where a bit grubby and the ceiling in the room above the bed had an access hole to the loft and it was surrounded with dirty hand-prints, not too much of a problem but when you are lying in bed you cant help but stare at it. The hairdryer in the bathroom was poor and the air conditioner was so noisy we had to turn it off, but we were not allowed the remote for it so we had to ask someone to change the settings on it, which was a bit odd. Overall it was an excellent place to stay and the location was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “A real gem among boutique hotels: one of a kind.”
Reviews.Author: PeteCanada
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 5 nights, in the Tolkien Suite at the rear of the house. The suite was a real gem, with antiques and a quiet ambience away from the noisy canal (especially important as the Dutch team was winning during the World Cup!). The room was true to its depiction on their website. Common rooms were elegant and beautifully decorated. My VIP treatment started right from check-in when I was asked to wait in the beautiful sitting room and drinks were provided while my luggage was hauled up the narrow stairs to my suite by an able assistant manager. All my requests were met with efficiency and punctuality, incl. a generous breakfast in my room each morning, afternoon wine and snacks, and extra amenities. I have not stayed in a nicer, more friendly "hotel" (I use quotation marks because this is not your typical luxury hotel, but a unique guest house that really is a home away from home). The house even provided guests with mosquito-repellent spray, which was useful being next to the canal during the hottest days of the summer. My only suggestion for improving this stellar property is to boost the power of the air conditioning units, particularly during the hot July month. It was barely adequate for the hottest days during my stay. Still, I will return here for future visits. Bravo to the management and staff.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel experience in a long time...”
Reviews.Author: alexclbrussels
Reviews.Content: After reading all the wonderful reviews here I booked two nights at the 717. While the location is amazing, the room (Mahler) wonderful and the general service realtively good, our trip was unfortunately ruined by the rather unbelievable behaviour of the female manager: This was the hottest weekend of the year so far and I especially went to 717 and did not stay on a houseboat in order to profit from the airconditioning in the rooms (not a given in Amsterdam). When returning to the hotel after dinner, the AC had been switched off and our remote control was missing. I called the concierge and he told me he was very sorry but the manager had asked him to take the remote away and not give it back as we should sleep with open windows -- it was over 30 degrees in the room even with windows open plus no mosquito mesh in front of windows and so mosquito attacks all night long, passed terrible night and when asking for explanation of this policy in the morning no answer was forthcoming. We felt as if we were treated like children that mustn't play with the gadgets at night...at 350 euros a night, outrageous behaviour! The dutch are often caricatured for their stingyness, and I can't but wonder whether the 'no AC at night policy' is indeed part of this myth?

Reviews.Title: “best hotel amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: yunamit
Reviews.Content: i spent 5nights at hotel seven on seven with my spouse. we really were satisfied with great service and cozy atmosphere and fully able to enjoy the trip of Amsterdam. Even though i had many experiences staying at several luxurious hotels, i have no dout to say that Hotel SEVEN ONE SEVEN was one of the best. luxurious interior, antique furnishings, breakfast, exclusive service 1:1, very kind staffs. If i have any chances to go Amsterdam again, I'll stay Hotel 717 without any hesitation. I really appreciate for kindness of the staffs there.

Reviews.Title: “The most genuine and personal welcome for those who have high standards but don't want to be treated like a number”
Reviews.Author: Dart69_10
Reviews.Content: 717 has a warmth and character all of its own that is very appealing for the regular traveller. It has style without being self concious and trying too hard. It knows wha it wants to be and does that well without fuss. I have been a regular guest over many years and always look forward to my visits.

Reviews.Title: “I am astounded about the beauty of Hotel...”
Reviews.Author: nyker2004
Reviews.Content: I am astounded about the beauty of Hotel 717. The owner was meticulous in restoring this 18th Century building in Amsterdam. Great care and attention to detail in furnishing the hotel has created a truly unique environment that is welcoming, warm and cozy. I literally felt as if I was returning home when I entered Hotel 717. I have been on a 2-week business trip throughout Europe, staying at many fine hotels. Hotel 717 is by far the best. But more to the point, Hotel 717 is a different kind of experience that is offered by even the best hotels in Europe. It is luxourious and has a cozy feeling of home at the same time. Finally, I would like to commend the excellent service. The staff is attentive and the service is entirely personalized, which is a nice change from the usually impersonal service that is available at many hotels. Thank you to the owner and staff of Hotel 717. You have made me a very happy and satisfied traveler.

Reviews.Title: “It was special and lovely!”
Reviews.Author: jule_h1
Reviews.Content: The service was very good, the staff was friendly and courteous. Also the room was very clean and the interior decoration is tasteful. The house is very charmingful and has a very familial touch. Best was the very nice breakfast with the fruitsalad at the beginning and the thoughtful waiter. All in all a very pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “If you are a type of person who likes service and comfort it is not for you.”
Reviews.Author: Diana0210
Reviews.Content: Location is good but there is no restaurant, fitness center or spa. So all you get is a room. Service is not great. You have to ask several times until you get what you need.

Reviews.Title: “Simply stunning boutique hotel. If comfortable high-end luxury is your thing, this is it!”
Reviews.Author: davidcubbin
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for the weekend last weekend on my trip to A'dam for a friend's 40th birthday party and found the hotel to be absolutely perfect. Located very centrally on one of the city's nicest canals, on a quiet street, Seven One Seven must be among the finest hotels couple of hotels in the city. The staff are very friendly and helpful, the rooms, both common areas and bedrooms, are simply sublime. I don't really need many amenities in-house, and had an excellent gym recommended to me which was only 100m or so away. I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Memorable experience”
Reviews.Author: Seoul75
Reviews.Content: Just as it was 7 years ago, 717 again provided us with a memorable experience of excellent service, perfect rooms and the ambiance of having a home away from home. This hotel is an absolute must for travellers who like a combination of an intimate atmosphere with superb service driven by a great eye for detail.

Reviews.Title: “Simple awesome”
Reviews.Author: MHPedersen
Reviews.Content: This is a proper luxury hotel. Forget about flashiness - marble and chandeliers etc - I would take this over Waldorf Astoria any time. Not that they are really comparable though; 717 has 8 big rooms only and they are furnished beautifully, stylish and with refined taste. Everything more or less is free; coffee, tea, minibar, good wines from the cellar served with olives, cheese and nuts, and staff is friendly and attentive. Location is in what I would consider one of the better and more interesting neighbourhoods of central Amsterdam. I found nothing to fault it on.

Reviews.Title: “Wedding anniversary”
Reviews.Author: DBO_10
Reviews.Content: A unique bed & breakfast ,located in the middle of historical Amsterdam. Unique is it's design,offering culture,warmth and professionalism.

Reviews.Title: “An oasis of peace, style, and subtile luxury”
Reviews.Author: JERMunich
Reviews.Content: A hidden gem for anyone who appreciates the tranquility of a small luxury hotel (8 suites only) in a beautifully rebuilt old Amsterdam townhouse located in the center of the Grachten district. The rooms are spacy, and superbly furnished and decorated (lots of antique furniture), the bathrooms are state-of.the art but adapted to the traditional style of the house. As space is at a premium, you will have to do without the usual amenities of a larger upmarket hotel, such as, for example, pool, gym, garage, and restaurant (the hotel serves breakfast only), but the very attentive, personal service will arrange for you almost anything you need. So just sit down in the lounge or library next to the open fireplace and enjoy life and a bottle of (the complimentary house) wine at the end of a busy day. As is true for most establishments of that kind, guests should have a basic level of physical fitness as there is no elevator and the staircases are quite steep. All in all a memorable stay!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location for a romantic getaway”
Reviews.Author: mrskWirral_Uk
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here on our first (childless) trip abroad following the arrival of our son. I found it on Mr and Mrs Smith and was planning to spoil us both with a bit of fun and luxury. We were not disappointed! The location near the Nine Streets is great and the coffee shops/restaurants and boutiques nearby make this the perfect place to stay for a top end city break which is exactly what we intended. Due to being snowed in (no flights leaving Schiphol - the same weekend the euro tunnel packed up just before Christmas!) we actually ended up staying an extra night again in a beautiful suite and even with the stress of not knowing how we were going to get home we had a marvellous time due in large part to the excellent assistance and information we were given by polite ,friendly and attentive but never intrusive staff. I would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “YOU HAVE TO STAY HERE”
Reviews.Author: LuxeGirl91
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at 717 for 4 nights in December and the stay was amazing. You really do feel like posh residents, climbing the steps to your exclusive home on the canal. The service is impeccable, the location pristine. My husband and I stayed in the Van Goethe suite, beautiful and finely appointed. Have breakfast delivered everyday in your room if you wish and after a day of sightseeing, the staff will prepare a bottle of wine and snacks for you to enjoy in your room. Super chic, super discreet, A+ service.

Reviews.Title: “the defenition of boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: shilod
Reviews.Content: As frequent travelers to Amsterdam, we stayed in many hotels in the past. None were worth a revisit. Then we run across the 717 online, read a review, and figured we should give it a shot. We booked a room and hope for the best, while fearing the notorious "boutique nightmare" - small and pricy room. Well, it's so not. The 717 is an amazing place. Decor is breath taking. Location is superb. And the room (Number 6) was spacious, cozy, and comfortable beyond anything we have seen. In the future it will definitely be our place in town. For us, the 717 is the defenition of boutique hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Everything is how it supposed to be in such a special environment”
Reviews.Author: Joost10
Reviews.Content: First I was a little shocked of the price but itâ€™s more than worth it. Really excellent service, nothing is a problem and they have all the time for the guests. Great roomy room, with a good comfortable bed and an excellent bad room. Middle in the center of Amsterdam, close to all different kind of shops but still very quiet. We loved it and we definitely come again to see Amsterdam in such a special environment.

Reviews.Title: “perfect location”
Reviews.Author: rblaupt
Reviews.Content: It's a lovely hotel on prinsengracht, so close to everywhere. The staff and the service is more than perfect, especially in a city like amsterdam. Loved every bit of it.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect hotel with spacious suites at a perfect location in the centre of Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: DenBoschCityhopper
Reviews.Content: During our stay, we really felt like private guests of the staff of Seven One Seven. At the same time 717 offers a lot of privacy. This cozy but luxurious hotel is situated in a beautiful monumental building. It contains everything you might need to feel at home in Amsterdam. Also the location in the heart of our capital couldn't been better! Shops, but also plenty of restaurants and bars are at walking distance. We stayed in the Von Goethe Suite, which was very spacious, luxurious and comfortable. For this reason we decided to enjoy (the delicious) breakfast in our room. We would love to visit this hotel again!;-)

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfully romantic”
Reviews.Author: jhboyk
Reviews.Content: If you have ever walked through Amsterdam wondering what it is like on the inside of the incredible houses that line the canals, this is your chance to find out in style. The location could not be better. Shopping is very close by, but you would never know it from how quiet the 700 block of the Prinzengracht is. It is a very short walk to the museums. It does not take long to get to the city centre but yet it is blissfully far from the sketchy scene. The staff is incredibly helpful and friendly and the rooms are extremely personal and inviting. We felt at home instantly. Two items that I love: free internet and free items from the mini-bar. I wish more hotels would build these ammenities into the overnight price. It really helps create the feeling of being a guest somewhere special as oppossed to just a customer in a business. Anyway, my wife and I plan on visiting again.

Reviews.Title: “The best 40th birthday ever!”
Reviews.Author: fiona1509
Reviews.Content: We stayed at 717 a couple of years ago, coming across the hotel in a Mr and Mrs Smith book, and had the best time. When thinking what to do to celebrate a reluctant 40th 717 came to mind and the team there could not have been more helpful. I was able to book the entire hotel for the weekend and we were all made to feel very at home. Our party included an 11 and 12 year old as well as 3 teenagers and their needs were well met too. A formal dinner was organised for the Saturday night, held in the dining room and was excellent, both in terms of quality and presentation. The staff are simply superb and made our stay there a joy from start to finish. The location is perfect for both the culture vultures and fashionistas. We will definitely revisit, hopefully soon!

Reviews.Title: “A perfect hideaway for a special treat”
Reviews.Author: jeremyet
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the 717 for a weekend in Amsterdam - we were travelling without our children and wanted to spoil ourselves and this was the perfect place to do it. We stayed in the Room at the Top, up several flights of steep stairs, which was a lovely room. Unlike so many hotels everything about the 717 felt personal - from the greeting in the wood-decorated entrance to the delivery of drinks and breakfast in our room. Service was impeccable - discreet, friendly and charming. The breakfast basket was lovely. One of the charms of this hotel is that drinks, breakfast, minibar and even wines and canapes brought to your room are included in the price - you don't leave feeling ripped off at spending $$$ on a bottle of mineral water from the minibar. Our one minor gripe was that the bathroom and bathroom products didn't match the indulgent feeling of the rest of the hotel, but this is a slight quibble. Given the opportunity to spoil ourselves in Amsterdam again, we would happily return to the 717.

Reviews.Title: “Hospitable and Stylish”
Reviews.Author: henj
Reviews.Content: Our stay in the prestigious hotel Seven One Seven was a present from our children. We enjoyed it very much. The cozy atmosphere of the room and the hospitality of the staff made us feel very welcome and at home. The room service and breakfast were of very good quality. We stayed in the Schubert suite at the front side of the building. It was furnished in a good style, with the exception of a big air conditioning unit. The hotel is situated in the old characteristic centre of Amsterdam and we could see and hear its lively town life, even at night. However the excellent beds fully compensated for this noise. There are many possibilities for going out in the neighborhood . We recommend this hotel to guests who like s stylish place.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, but sshhh, don't tell anyone!”
Reviews.Author: hungryperson
Reviews.Content: Hotel 717 is my favourite hotel in Amsterdam. The staff are friendly and efficient. When I told them I was trying to learn Dutch they all encouraged me and spent time speaking Dutch to me (but they all speak very good English too!). The rooms are charming and spacious. There are only seven in the hotel plus a terrace, a library and a generous sitting room. It's more like being in someone's lovely house in Amsterdam than in a hotel. It's nicely designed without being 'designery' and overwhelming - smart, grown up but still 'gezellig' (cosy). Although it is quite expensive everything is inclusive so breakfast, coffee, tea and drinks in the evening plus the mini-bar plus wireless internet access and CDs/DVDs are all included in the price. I only have two problems with 717: first, I can't stay there as often as I would like and second, I don't want anyone else to stay there because I want to keep it as my little secret.

Reviews.Title: “What a unique hotel!”
Reviews.Author: AJMK1978
Reviews.Content: This summer we've stayed in the beautiful "Picasso" suite, of the hotel Seven One Seven. It was recommended to us by friends, who had stayed there about a year ago. To put it short: we've had a great stay! The hotel is located in the middle of the center so the shops and museums were very easy to reach. The rooms are all decorated differently, but with the same "coming home" feeling to it. We really enjoyed coming back "home" to the hotel for a drink and a little relaxation. The staff was very friendly and easy going, which altogether made it a week to remember!

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: rigboy
Reviews.Content: My partner and i stayed at this hotel over the Easter period. The hotel is lovely, very unique and situated right in the heart of Amsterdam with a fabualus address. We stayed in the 'Shubert' suite at the front of the building and was very fine in every way, beautifull room overlooking the Prinsingrahct.... The staff were all very helpfull with all our requests, not in your face but always there when you needed them. They helped us with restaurant resavations...The breakfast served in the hotel is very fine in there lovely dining room...This hotel is small, very comfortable and really is a 'Hidden Gem'

Reviews.Title: “one of the worst hotel experiences i've ever had!”
Reviews.Author: gl1972
Reviews.Content: i stayed in the mahler room for two nights. the room was ok, however the double bed was comprised of two single mattresses which joined in the middle and was pretty uncomfortable. also, it was noisy. the room is above what sounded like tumble dryers which were on at around 9.30pm one night. i was woken very early in the morning by slamming doors. i suppose this can be expected in small old townhouse... BE WARNED. i was booked to stay for 21 nights on business. i only ended up staying for 2 nights. i had to return to london because of an unforseen family situation. when i gave notice of my departure, i was told i'd be charged for the whole 21 nights. 5000 euros. the manageress was extremely and unnecessarily aggressive. her and her receptionist told me in no uncertain terms that apparently the website makes their policy clear. they were completely inflexible on this. if you change your arrangements PRIOR to the first night of your stay you pay a notice period of 4 NIGHTS. but if you have already COMMENCED your stay, you are liable for THE WHOLE AMOUNT. although the small print on the website states this, it was not made clear in correspondence she had directly with my office who asked if we could be flexible should i wish to shorten my stay. we were assured we'd only have to give 4 day notice period there was never any mention of notice being given prior to the stay. obviously, changing circumstances are a reality of business travel. in all my years of staying in hotels around the world i have NEVER come across such a mean cancellation policy. i also, object to being treated so aggressively by the manageress, i was made to feel extremely uncomfortable by her and her receptionist. i agree with some of the other reviews on this site....the atmosphere in this place is strange to say the least. i feel totally ripped off and am now consulting legal action. needless to say, none of my colleagues will stay there in future. they have lost out on a huge amount of business from me, my company and my friends.

Reviews.Title: “A very good hotel but a few minor quibbles”
Reviews.Author: acontributor
Reviews.Content: Choosing a hotel for a city break can be difficult.Book the wrong property in terms of location,size,features or ambience and your enjoyment of the city itself can be detrimentally affected.This is particularly true of Amsterdam because parts of it are frankly seedy and unlike cities like Paris or Rome its attractiveness is not immediately apparent. We first visited Amsterdam seven months ago and stayed at the Banks Mansion. Even for a small city Banks felt a little out on a limb and in terms of looks and character could have been anywhere. It didn't do Amsterdam any favours. After much consideration we decided to give the city another try and chose the 717.The trip was much more enjoyable. First the negatives and which have featured in some other reviews.It is expensive. Noise from the street is a bit of problem.The hotel is very near the Leidesplein and you do get alot of late night revellers.We stayed during a very stormy March.I imagine the noise could be worse during the peak summer period.There are plastic flowers.The service can be bit hit and miss,eg the need to remnd the staff we had ordered tea.On the first two nights we returned to the room to find it had been tidied and the shutters on the windows closed but not on the final night.Lack of double glazing and inferior heating in the room meant it could be a bit chilly.But these are minor quibbles. Now thepositives. Overall, the location was great.After a night visiting Boom Chicago and Jazz Cafe Alto we able to walk back to the hotel in minutes.Whilst there was street noise it was not threatening and didn't make for too disturbed a night.The hotel is within 15 minutes walking distance of all major attractions.The staff are extremely friendly and are eager to please.We were offered afternoon tea each evening.Complimentary wine was always available. The hotel itself was very well appointed and charming.The bedrooms are very large.We stayed in the Picasso suite which is extremely spacious.They could use the space to put in a larger bathroom and a power shower wouldn't go amiss. Particularly after a day or evening out in the cold it was great to to come back to sit in one of the cosy lounges with fire. This leads to the most important point.Without being twee,the hotel excels in giving you a feel for living in a genuine old canalside house.The minor flaws are worth having to be able to have this experience. If you want antiseptic perfection book into a large chain hotel which could be anywhere in the world. I think some people book and constantly think about the price during the stay.This can only cause them to over emphasise the defects. If you decide to book, put all consideration of cost to one sideand just enjoy the hotel for what it is.We will remember this hotel fondly long after we've forgotten many other places we've visited.

Reviews.Title: “Rock and Roll all Night Long! Get your party on...”
Reviews.Author: VotingRightsNow
Reviews.Content: This was our 4th time staying at 717. Each previous time the rooms were superb, the service gracious, the location great, and we left wondering what more could you want from a small hotel/B&B? We wonder no more. We booked the room at the Top, which has a window facing the canal. It's a steep climb up the stairs, but the room was large and pleasantly decorated. I must, however, agree with the previous comment about the plastic flowers. At these prices, a few real flowers would have been nice. The bed is towards the front of the room, just underneath the window. Our first night was fine; we were tired from the flight over. We slept well. Breakfast was pleasant, but the service quirky as others have noted in their reviews. Little did we know, it appears since we last stayed there several years ago, that a rock and roll club had opened just across the canal. Bedlam was about to begin around 11pm, or was it midnight? It's tough to tell when you're woken from your sleep. Friday night was bad. It was loud, but we thought that it was part of staying in an active urban area. We voiced no complaint. Saturday night was awful. Dreadful. We had friends, from Germany, stay in one of the suites overlooking the canal. They were finally able to go to sleep sometime around 2 or 3 in the morning. We fared no better. It sounded as if the rock and roll club had thrown open its doors and the party was on the street, right outside the hotel. Firecrackers, drunken revelry, cars honking, bands playing, fights, screaming, etc. At this price, or at any price really, part of the implicit compact between a guest and the proprieter is that they'll do everything possible to provide a satisfactory and restful stay. Unfortuneately, this wasn't the case. We complained bitterly. No matter how charming the rooms, that's it's constantly held up as a shining example of how to run a small establishment, that it's a legendary hip hotel...none of that is worth the price we paid for not being able to sleep through the evening. The problem isn't going away till the rock and roll club closes. Do yourself a favor, ask about the club when making your reservation. If it's still open and you want to stay up till 2 or 3, grab a dozen beers, or roll a joint if that's more your style and join the party at the club or on the dancing in the streets. Otherwise, if you want a restful stay while in Amsterdam, other establishments may be able to provide the setting for a good nights sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Home from home”
Reviews.Author: crispyduck
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend suprised with a trip to Amsterdam and he did his research well and chose this lovely cosy hotel for 2 nights. We stayed in Shakespeare on the 1st floor and it is an enormous and gorgeous room with sumptuous fabrics and and a really a comfy sofa. Also a rather fancy B&O TV which impressed him very much!! We only saw one other couple in the hotel and had the elegant and snug lounge to ourselves late one evening with a lovely bottle of complementary wine and very nice snacks (without having to request them which is always nice) The hotel organised a restaurant for us and taxi's etc and we were impressed with the professionalism. The downsides to this room were minimal but considering the cost perhaps worth mentioning: Being so near the ground floor meant that we did hear the hotel phone ringing but it wasn't much of an issue. There was no air con and it was a bit too hot and stuffy which I imagine in Summer could be more of a problem. The bathroom was tired and certainly not luxurious but adequate. If this had been updated the room would have been fantastic. The staff were friendly and polite and breakfast in bed arrived on the dot and in a huge basket which was a lovely touch and also had delicious freshly squeezed orange juice. Something was always missing though, ie. no milk, no butter and on the last day 2 boiled eggs with no egg cups!! We did not eat downstairs as we just wanted to be pampered and lazy which was such a treat! These really are minor faults though and the overall experience is to be recommended. I would have loved a room with a view though - I think that a canal view would have made this stay even more special. There's no pleasing some people is there?! If you are looking for a romantic retreat with absolutely no hint of pretentiousness then this hotel is for you and it would take very little to make this place perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely space and location but noisy and inefficient”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We recently went to 717 and were wowed by the charm and design of it. The restoration of this old building/house was fantastic and the decorating. Like another person said, a welcome change from the sleek minimalist look of so many hotels trying to be so cool. We stayed in the Tolkein room which was as pretty as it seemed in the on-line photos however--- it was UNBEARABLY noisy. It was like being in someone else's house. Forget about relaxation. For some insane reason, in this humongous room, they decided to put the bed smack-dab next to the door that opens onto the main stairwell leading to all the rooms (no elevator). So you really felt like you were well aware of all your neighbors comings and goings including their conversations. You could even hear conversations that were taking place two flights down at the front desk at the bottom of the stairs. Worse than the stairs, was the fact that the staff/cleaning supply room/lounge was just a few steps down from our door. Starting at 7am, that door was literally opened and closed twice or more every five minutes on the average. You could not only hear the creaking of the hinges but also when it shut-- OVER and OVER and OVER... we would sleep during the five min intervals and had a horrible sleep each night. we were NOT there for business. We told the staff each night to please make sure that the morning person was informed to please be considerate and enter this room quietly. During a four day stay, we only got one hour's worth of their compliance to that request. We got the feeling that they thought we were inflexible which ticked us off all the more. Also, we found that the hotel staff was friendly but in many ways inept regarding their concierge services. For example, we called down one afternoon to ask them to call the restaurant they had booked for us for that evening and see if they could be called and the reservation pushed back a little later. The person at the desk (at all times there was only one person available or in sight) told us that he did not know which restaurant we had been booked at and he'd have to call his colleague at home to find out. Why was there not a general log of this stuff like a normal luxury hotel?? The breakfast was really nice and the atmosphere of the dining space super nice. All in all, it has a lot of charm, but I would never stay there again if I were going there to have a relaxing weekend. You'll be up at 7! A couple we met staying in a nearby room from New Orleans, had the exact same sentiments as we did- especially regarding the staff room door issue--and their bed was way away from their door!! All our friends told us to go to Blake's which is now called something else... will try that next time! S Spencer

Reviews.Title: “Good, but value for money?”
Reviews.Author: taches
Reviews.Content: I have no problems spending money on a good hotel. The price is far less important than the value I receive for what I pay. Seven one seven is a pretty hotel, well-located and discreet. I stayed there for 2 nights last weekend with my boyfriend and after a day of sight-seeing in cold and snowy weather, it felt very cozy to return to its richly coloured walls, crackling fireplace and intimate atmosphere (I'm not sure that the flannel-covered sofas, tweed curtains and deep paint colours would feel quite so soothing during hot summer months). There were many lovely touches in the hotel. Complimentary wine and snacks brought to one's room, fragrant fresh flowers in the marble entry way, shelves full of interesting books at the patrons' disposal. However, I also feel as though the hotel is resting on the sublime reviews it has received. For example, in both our rooms (we stayed in the Tolkein the first night, Room at the Top the second), all the plants were fake. You would think that in a room that costs more than $600US/ night, in a city where a dozen cut tulips can be purchased for less than $10, they would try to avoid the plastic plant syndrome, or at least supplement the fake with a vase of simple flowers! The ceiling in our Room at the Top bathroom was badly stained and cracked (see attached photos). And sometimes the decorating felt just too excessive. Although I really appreciate a hotel that isn't slave to the current sleek and minimalist trends, most of the tables in the place were so covered with ralph-laurenesque tchochkes that I couldn't find space to set down my drink, and feared that I would knock over the collection of antique fountain pens, a painted plate, a fake plant... Most of the other guests seemed to be corporate types who used the salon or study in the evening to host business acquaintances. For these patrons, the price was probably worth it, since it has the air of a private club and having a few client 'round for a bottle of (complementary) wine in front of a lovely fire is better value than taking them out to a nice dinner. However, I'm not sure that for me and mine the value was there.

Reviews.Title: “A role model for other establishments”
Reviews.Author: mjmorin
Reviews.Content: Just returned from our first visit to Amsterdam and will definitely return primarily due to our excellent experience with Hotel 717. The hotel itself is wonderfully quirky with gorgeous rooms; however , it was the service and friendliness of the staff that sets it apart from the many other boutique hotels we have sampled. After a long day walking outside on a cold, rainy weekend, it was a pleasure to return to the fireplace downstairs and be offered wine and snacks. There was no haughty attitude and they treated every guest as special, including a couple that simply dropped in for a tour. Even when the hotel was full, privacy was complete and quiet (even with a toddler present). My only complaint was about the noise from the canal - we stayed in the Shubert suite and it was noisy late into the night. Maybe insulated glass is in their future plans. Stellar!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CPGM
Reviews.Content: We have just spent three nights at this lovely hotel. The decor was excellent. However, the best aspect of this hotel is the staff. They could not do enough to help and were all lovely. The hotel is also located in the perfect place to explore Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderfull Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a wonderfull trip to Amsterdam. We often visit the city and have stayed in most of the good hotels. This time we stayed at Hotel 717 and were so impressed that we will be staying only there in future. Small, stylish and wonderfully friendly and comfortable, the room was so nice that we actually looked forward to returning to the room with its view over Prisengracht. The location is perfect and the ambiance just right. The place is reminiscent of the Soniat House in New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel 717”
Reviews.Author: starwoodhotelssuck
Reviews.Content: Wow. This is just what we were looking for. Our first night in Amsterdam and all I wanted to do was drink the good wine and never get up from that warm and cozy sofa. We were at the end of a three week trip through Switzerland and Germany and the one thing we could not stop talking about was the simple luxury of 717. We stayed in the Picasso suite with a great view of the canal. We would recommend this guest house to anyone looking for a special place to go to at the end of the day.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant and quirky 717”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have been to 717 twice and found it a beautiful place to come back to after hours of walking. It is a strange mixture of elegance (a beautiful canal house, beautiful colours) and quirky (some of the over the top house contents) and scarcely seems like a hotel. The service is not obsequious and superb. Strongly reccomended.Only two down points:I went alone and that made it very expensiveThere were paper not cloth napkins in the breakfast room, reducing the sense of pampered luxury.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Seven one Seven
HotelInfo.Address: Prinsengracht 717, Amsterdam 1017 JW, The Netherlands
